results.title: Where a Vast Global Vaccination Program Went Wrong
results.abstract: After months of struggle, the U.N.-backed Covax alliance will soon have many more doses, promising relief for vaccine shortages in poorer countries. But it faces a deepening crisis: difficulties getting shots into arms as the Delta variant spreads.
results.byline: By Benjamin Mueller and Rebecca Robbins

multimedia.caption: Carrying a box of vaccines this spring in Goma, in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The country received 1.7 million AstraZeneca doses through Covax in March, but distribution is another challenge.

results.title: With #MeToo Case, China Takes a Swipe at Celebrity Obsession
results.abstract: The detention of Kris Wu, a popular Canadian singer, has been hailed as a rare victory for the movement. But Beijing, wary of social activism, has cast it as a warning to celebrities.
results.byline: By Amy Qin and Elsie Chen

multimedia.caption: The performer Kris Wu at a movie premiere in Los Angeles in 2017. He has become perhaps the most prominent figure in China to be detained over #MeToo allegations.

results.title: As Ethiopia’s Civil War Rages, Bodies Float Downriver Into Sudan
results.abstract: The disfigured bodies are the latest indication of atrocities as the conflict over the Tigray region spreads to other parts of Ethiopia and across international borders.
results.byline: By Simon Marks and Declan Walsh
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

multimedia.caption: The Sitit River, known as the Tekeze River in Ethiopia, near Sudan’s border with Ethiopia.  Dozens of bloated bodies have washed onto these shores.

results.title: Influencer in chief: Macron answers vaccine skeptics on TikTok and Instagram.
results.abstract: As governments look to social media influencers to try to raise vaccination rates among the young, President Emmanuel Macron of France is making his own self-consciously informal videos.

results.title: Will These Places Survive a Collapse? Don’t Bet on It, Skeptics Say.

results.title: Britain Rethinks Letting China Enter Its Nuclear Power Industry
results.abstract: Financing and security issues are clouding new power station projects.

multimedia.caption: The Hinkley Point C nuclear power station construction site near Bridgwater, England, in 2020. China General Nuclear, China’s state-owned nuclear company, owns a third of the project.
